sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"流动，涌出"之意。
means: flow ： 侧重水继续不断地往前流，不关心其流量的大小和速度的快慢。
run ： 指液体向任何方向流动，暗示比flow快而有力。
stream ： 指水或其它液体从源头流出，不断地朝某一方向流动，可用作引申。
pour ： 通常指从高向低或从上向下的急剧流动。也可作引申用。

sentence.Network_en: Stir the sauce and pour it over the top.
sentence.Network_cn: 搅拌调味汁，把它浇在上面。

sentence.Network_en: Any day now, the Northern forces may pour across the new border.
sentence.Network_cn: 北方的军队现在随时都可能大批越过新边界。

sentence.Network_en: Pour the mixture into the cake tin and bake for 45 minutes.
sentence.Network_cn: 把混合物倒进烤模烤制45分钟。

phrase.cizu_name: it never rains but it pours

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)misfortunes or difficult situations tend to follow each other in rapid succession or to arrive all at the same time
(N. Amer. informal)progress or work quickly or with all one's energy
try to settle a disagreement or dispute with words intended to placate or pacify those involved

encyclopedia.content: 基本释义 ( pours; poured; pouring ) vt. & vi. 涌出 rush together in large numbers vt. & vi. 倾； 倒 cause liquid or sth that flows like liquid to flow基本要点 1.pour的基本意思是指大量液体由高向低或由上向下倾倒。引申可指人或物大批地、源源不断地涌入或涌出。 2.pour既可用作及物动词，也可用作不及物动词。用作及物动词时，接名词或代词作宾语，也可接双宾语，其间接宾语可以转换为介词for的宾语。pour还

entry.tran: 使（液体等）连续流出；倾倒；倒出
entry.def: If you pour a liquid or other substance, you make it flow steadily out of a container by holding the container at an angle.

example.ex: Pour a pool of sauce on two plates and arrange the meat neatly...
example.tran: 在两个盘子里倒少许沙司酱，然后把肉摆放整齐。

example.ex: Francis poured a generous measure of the whisky into a fresh glass...
example.tran: 弗朗西斯往一个干净的玻璃杯里倒了很多威士忌。

entry.def: If you pour someone a drink, you put some of the drink in a cup or glass so that they can drink it.

example.ex: He got up and poured himself another drink...
example.tran: 他站起身来，给自己又倒了一杯。

example.ex: She asked Tillie to pour her a cup of coffee...
example.tran: 她请蒂莉给她倒杯咖啡。

entry.def: When a liquid or other substance pours somewhere, for example through a hole, it flows quickly and in large quantities.

example.ex: Blood was pouring from his broken nose...
example.tran: 血从他受伤的鼻子里涌出来。

example.ex: There was dense smoke pouring from all four engines...

entry.def: When it rains very heavily, you can say that it is pouring.

example.ex: It has been pouring in Delhi almost non stop for the past three days, disrupting normal life...
example.tran: 德里市在过去的3天里一直在下着倾盆大雨，几乎没有停过，扰乱了人们的正常生活。

example.ex: It has been pouring with rain all week...
example.tran: 一个星期以来一直在下着瓢泼大雨。

entry.def: If people pour into or out of a place, they go there quickly and in large numbers.

example.ex: Any day now, the Northern forces may pour across the new border...
example.tran: 北方的军队现在随时都可能大批越过新边界。

example.ex: Holidaymakers continued to pour down to the coast in search of surf and sun...
example.tran: 度假者不断涌至海边冲浪和享受阳光。

entry.def: If something such as information pours into a place, a lot of it is obtained or given.

example.ex: Martin, 78, died yesterday. Tributes poured in from around the globe...
example.tran: 马丁于昨天去世，享年78岁。世界各地的人们纷纷致以哀悼。

example.ex: The commission has invited interested parties to submit comments, and these are now pouring in.
example.tran: 委员会已邀请各当事方递交意见，现在意见书纷至沓来。

entry.def: If someone pours cold water on a plan or idea, they criticize it so much that people lose their enthusiasm for it.

example.ex: The education secretary poured cold water on the recommendations of a working party.
example.tran: 教育大臣对一个工作小组的建议泼冷水。

sentences.sentence: "people were pouring out of the theater"

means.word_mean: 5. supply in large amounts or quantities;

sentences.sentence: "We poured money into the education of our children"
"Put on your rain coat-- it's pouring outside!"

auth_sentence.content: Pour in the milk mixture and stir to combine.
auth_sentence.res_content: Pour in the milk mixture and stir to combine.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Pour in the milk mixture and stir to combine.

auth_sentence.content: Pour in the oil and two-thirds of the water.
auth_sentence.res_content: Pour in the oil and two-thirds of the water.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Pour in the oil and two-thirds of the water.

auth_sentence.content: Pour over a generous amount of gravy and serve.
auth_sentence.res_content: Pour over a generous amount of gravy and serve.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Pour over a generous amount of gravy and serve.

Sentence.sentence: One mother said that before her daughter was involved in this project, she would not even pour a weed.
Runaway fires pour even more carbon into the air, which increases temperatures, starting the whole vicious cycle all over again.
We can tear apart the great grass cover of the western plains and pour toxic chemicals into the soil until the soil is dead and blows away in the wind.

The university has poured resources into peer counseling to help students from inner-city schools adjust to the rigor (严格要求) and faster pace of a university classroom –and also to help minority students overcome the stereotype that they are less qualified.

sentences.en: After the meeting the people poured out in crowds.
sentences.cn: 散会后人们成群地涌出来。

sentences.en: The chimney was pouring out black smoke.
She poured a glass of water.
He poured me a cup of tea.
Andy poured the glass full and lifted it to Bobby.
sentences.cn: 安迪把杯子倒满举着送给鲍比。

jushi.english: At six that evening it began to pour.
jushi.chinese: 那天傍晚六点钟开始下起瓢泼大雨来。
